page.title: 02COUNTESTHORPE - LANDSCAPE
page.content: The countryside surrounding Countesthorpe is quite flat and gently rolling,the highest point being about 300ft. The main crops consist of wheat, barley and rape,but most fields are used for pasturing cattle and sheep. There are small farms scattered around. Many fields show the old ridge and furrow patterns from the middle ages strip farming. There are no woods and only a few spinneys (for cover for foxes). Having no rivers but numerous streams fishing is restricted to private ponds. Many footpaths lead through the fields without damaging crops. The fields have birds ranging from sparrows to herons. The countryside is superb.
